Get started

Source: vignettes/r2dii.Rmd
r2dii.Rmd

As usual, start by using the r2dii package with:

library(r2dii)
#> Loading required package: r2dii.dataraw
#> Loading required package: r2dii.utils

Creating data snapshots

take_snapshot() allows you to take snapshots of multiple datasets. Its default behavior is sensible, but conservative and potentially slow (see take_snapshot()). You may want to change the default arguments.

Use:

  • datasets to snapshot specific datasets.
  • Use destdir to customize the destination directory.
  • Use config to provide a custom configuration file to take_snapshot().
datasets <- c("RevenueSplit", "BENCH.REGIONS")
custom_destdir <- tempdir()
custom_config <- example_config("config-toy.yml")

take_snapshot(
  datasets,
  destdir = custom_destdir, 
  config = custom_config
)
#> Wrote 'config-toy.yml' to '/tmp/RtmpqOFoA2/config-toy.yml'.
#> Warning in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open compressed file '/home/travis/
#> Dropbox (2° Investing)/2° Investing Team/People/Klaus/GitHub/Reference/
#> ReferenceData/BenchRegions.rda', probable reason 'No such file or
#> directory'
#> Warning: Can't write the following datasets:
#> RevenueSplit, BENCH.REGIONS

Use:

  • overwrite = TRUE to overwrite existing snapshots.
take_snapshot(
  datasets,
  destdir = custom_destdir, 
  config = custom_config
)
#> Skipping existing snapshot of 'config-toy.yml'.
#> Warning in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open compressed file '/home/travis/
#> Dropbox (2° Investing)/2° Investing Team/People/Klaus/GitHub/Reference/
#> ReferenceData/BenchRegions.rda', probable reason 'No such file or
#> directory'
#> Warning: Can't write the following datasets:
#> RevenueSplit, BENCH.REGIONS

# Overwrite
take_snapshot(
  datasets,
  destdir = custom_destdir, 
  config = custom_config,
  overwrite = TRUE
)
#> Wrote 'config-toy.yml' to '/tmp/RtmpqOFoA2/config-toy.yml'.
#> Warning in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open compressed file '/home/travis/Dropbox (2° Investing)/2° Investing Team/People/Klaus/GitHub/Reference/ReferenceData/BenchRegions.rda', probable reason 'No such file or directory'

#> Warning in gzfile(file, "rb"): Can't write the following datasets:
#> RevenueSplit, BENCH.REGIONS
  • options(r2dii_config = <custom_config>) replaces config and affects your R session globally.
restore <- options(r2dii_config = custom_config)

take_snapshot(
  datasets,
  destdir = custom_destdir, 
  overwrite = TRUE
)
#> Wrote 'config-toy.yml' to '/tmp/RtmpqOFoA2/config-toy.yml'.
#> Warning in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open compressed file '/home/travis/
#> Dropbox (2° Investing)/2° Investing Team/People/Klaus/GitHub/Reference/
#> ReferenceData/BenchRegions.rda', probable reason 'No such file or
#> directory'
#> Warning: Can't write the following datasets:
#> RevenueSplit, BENCH.REGIONS

options(restore)

Documentation

You can access the high level documentation of the package with ?r2dii.dataraw. At the bottom you may click Index to access the help files of all topics. As usual, you can access the help file of any topic with ?topic.

A good way to learn about all features is to explore the “r2dii.dataraw” tab of the private package-website:

if (interactive()) browse_private_site()

Please help me improve the documentation via pull requests.

Create paths

A family of functions create robust paths.

path_dropbox_2dii()
#> /home/travis/Dropbox (2° Investing)

(The root directory for you may look like C:/Users/You/...)

Configuration file

A family of functions help you to deal with the configuration file.

edit_config() opens the default configuration file so you can edit it.

if (interactive()) edit_config()

(I’m not in an interactive session so the chunk above won’t run.)

get_config() outputs a path to a configuration file. By default it outputs the path to the default configuration file – stored in the r2dii.dataraw package.

get_config()
#> [1] "/home/travis/R/Library/r2dii.utils/config.yml"

show_config() shows a configuration file.

show_config(get_config(), n_max = 10)
default:
  Methodology:
    HasBookValue: FALSE # ignore
    HasRISK: TRUE # ignore a flag specifying if the physical risk assessment should be done
    HasMAP: TRUE # flag to specify if map data (production per country) should be prepared
    HasSB: FALSE # ignore for now

  TimeStamps:
    # setting the dates of the data-input for financial and asset-level data: this identifies the input files
    FinancialData.Timestamp: 2018Q4 # specifies the Financial data sourcing date ie from which date the financial information is taken

You can change the default configuration file globally via options().

your_config <- example_config("config-toy.yml")
restore <- options(r2dii_config = your_config)

get_config()
[1] "/home/travis/R/Library/r2dii.utils/config-toy.yml"

show_config(get_config())
default:
  Expect:
   param_a: a
   param_1: 1
   param_true: TRUE
   param_false: FALSE
   param_unset:
  TimeStamps:
    ALD.Timestamp: 3333
    FinancialData.Timestamp: 2018Q3

options(restore)

Access configuration parameters and create configuration-sensitive paths

A family of functions are sensitive to the configuration file you use. This includes all functions to access configuration parameters, and some of the functions to create paths.

# Using the default configuration file
getOption("r2dii_config")
#> NULL
FINANCIAL.TIMESTAMP()
#> [1] "2018Q4"
FIN.DATA.PATH()
#> /home/travis/Dropbox (2° Investing)/PortCheck/00_Data/02_FinancialData/2018Q4

# Using your configuration file
your_config <- example_config("config-toy.yml")
restore <- options(r2dii_config = your_config)
FINANCIAL.TIMESTAMP()
#> [1] "2018Q3"
FIN.DATA.PATH()
#> /home/travis/Dropbox (2° Investing)/PortCheck/00_Data/02_FinancialData/2018Q3

options(restore)

Extending functions to access configuration parameters

Eventually you will likely need to access new configuration parameters. How would you expand this family of functions?

Use get_param() to create new functions to access configuration parameters.

# Create a `get_a_value()` function to get `a_value` from `a_field`
get_a_value <- get_param("a_field")

# Create an example configuration file
config <- glue::glue("
   default:
     a_field: a_value
 ")

show_config(config)
  default:
    a_field: a_value
# Write the config file to a temporary file
config_file <- tempfile()
readr::write_lines(config, config_file)

get_a_value(file = config_file)
#> [1] "a_value"

Datasets

A family of functions allow you to read local datasets from your local 2dii Dropbox-folder, e.g.:

# Not showing this for privacy
ALD.BV()

A family of datasets become directly available when you attach the r2dii.dataraw package, e.g.:

INDEX.REGIONS
#> function () 
#> {
#>     path <- path_reference("ReferenceData", "IndexRegions.rda")
#>     IndexRegions_raw <- as_tibble(readr::read_rds(path))
#>     IndexRegions_raw %>% mutate(CountryISO = if_else(.data$Country == 
#>         "Namibia" & is.na(.data$CountryISO), "NA", .data$CountryISO)) %>% 
#>         purrr::modify_if(is.factor, as.character)
#> }
#> <bytecode: 0x6b1aaa0>
#> <environment: namespace:r2dii.dataraw>

GROUPS.GOVT
#> function () 
#> {
#>     c("Sovereign", "Sovereign Agency", "Municipal", "Municipal-City", 
#>         "Municipal-County", "Multi-National", "Regional", "Regional(state/provnc)", 
#>         "Export/Import Bank", "Regional Authority", "Regional Agencies")
#> }
#> <bytecode: 0x6b7a3f8>
#> <environment: namespace:r2dii.dataraw>

Some datasets are sensitive to the configuration file, which you can always check with get_config().

get_config()
#> [1] "/home/travis/R/Library/r2dii.utils/config.yml"
